Define what constitutes a sequence of positive integers whose sum equals n.
Consider the composition of n, which is a way to write n as the sum of a sequence of positive integers.
Determine the relation of the first element of the sequence, say k, to the sum n.
Assess how the problem changes when the first element is fixed as k.
Calculate the number of sequences for the remaining sum n-k, where k varies from 1 to n.
Sum the number of valid sequences for each possible first element to find the total number of sequences for sum n.
Identify the mathematical expression that encapsulates the pattern or relationship found in the previous steps.
